back: lidar com (nós precisamos lidar com as alterações)

front: chip in (everyone chipped in for the gift)
see off (we saw our friends off at the airport yesterday)
back: despedir (nós despedimos de nossos amigos no aeroporto ontem)

front: on the loose (lions on the loose)
set apart (I set apart some money for my trip)
back: separar (eu separei algum dinheiro para minha viagem)

front: skid (Tony's car skidded on some ice and hit a tree)
back: derrapar, derrapagem (o carro do Tony derrapou no gelo e atingiu uma arvore)

front: dress up (you can dress up mannequins for display. When customers see them, they'll come in)
as though (On the other hand, we must not behave as though nothing has happened)
sleep around (if you sleep around, you increase your risk of getting AIDS / I never knew she was the kind that sleeps around)
back: have many casual sexual partners (termo pejorativo)

front: go out of [pronoum] way (she really went out of her way to get you this job interview)
back: se esforçar, fazer o possível (ela realmente se esforçou para conseguir essa entrevista de emprego para voce)

front: whatchamacallit (I need a whatchamacallit, you know that thing you use to pay)
back: coisa / algo que vc nao lembra o nome (eu preciso de uma coisa, vc sabe aquela coisa usada para pagar)

front: homage (As an homage to the Terminal, we liked the idea of naming the font after its codename)
dodge (Boris dodges questions on brexit)
scare to death (I am scared to death of cats / my sister is scared to death of cats)
back: 'morre de medo' – usar com verbo to be (eu morro de medo de gatos / minha irmã morre de medo de gatos)

front: slam (he slammed China on Twitter when LeBron was on his way to China)
back: criticar (informal) – (ele criticou China no Twitter enquanto LeBron estava indo pra China)

front: well–off, well off (my parents were well–off / now I’m well–off; I have my own room)
back: rico, bem de vida, abundante (não apenas em dinheiro)

front: wary (dogs that have been mistreated often remain very wary of strangers)
ripple effect (it has a ripple effect throughout the economy)
back: efeito cascata (isso tem um efeito cascata por toda a economia)

front: get on (can we please get on, because there are a lot of things still to discuss)
back: continuar, progredir (nós podemos continuar por favor, pq há muitas coisas ainda a discutir)

front: cut corners (the product is made with inferior materials to cut corners on costs)
back: economizar (o produto é feito com materiais inferiores para economizar custos) / pegar atalhos

front: crave (they promise people the things they crave)
back: almejar (eles prometem as pessoas coisas que eles almejam) / desejar

front: spook (it's extremely easy to spook this fish)
back: assustar (é extremamente fácil assustar esse peixe) / fantasma (mesmo que ghost) / espião (a CIA spook)

front: jump the gun (some booksellers have jumped the gun and decided to sell it early)
back: to act too soon or before the right time (alguns vendedores de livros se anteciparam e decidiram vender isso mais cedo)

front: laughter (her laughter filled the place with joy) – lê–se 'láfter'
back: riso, risos, risada (o riso dela encheu o lugar de alegria) – noun

front: convicted (that man is a convicted terrorist)
back: condenado (aquele homem é um terrorista condenado)

front: keen (both had keen scientific minds)
back: aguçado – adj. (ambos tinham mentes científicas aguçadas)

front: dismay (to his dismay, she left him)
back: desânimo / desanimar (para seu desânimo, ela o deixou)

front: peel (NOUN: remove the orange peel and cut it into thin strips / VERB: I started the recipe by peeling the potatoes)
back: casca (remova a casca da laranja e corte–a em tiras finas) / descascar (eu comecei a receita descascando as batatas)

front: flattered (I am flattered you want to talk to me) / flatter
go by (a couple moments go by and I feel something)
back: passar (alguns momentos se passam e eu sinto algo)

front: oblivious (people still remain oblivious to what happened yesterday)
cave in (help me, it's like the walls are caving in)
back: desmoronar [verb] (ajude me, é como se as paredes estivessem desmoronando)

front: just off (the island is just off the coast of Florida)
raffle (the first prize in the raffle is a trip to Miami)
back: rifa (o primeiro prêmio na rifa é uma viagem pra Miami)

front: boast (the student likes to boast of his grades / it may sound like a boast, but I truly am very wealthy)
back: gabar, orgulhar (o estudante gosta de se gabar de suas notas) / ostentação [noun]

front: makeshift (he arranged a row of chairs to form a makeshift bed)
bad–mouth (no one wants to hire an individual who bad–mouths a prior employer)
back: criticar, falar mal (he is a bad–mouther)

front: either one (coffee or tea? Either one, I like both)
be down to (once the strategy is decided, it will be down to authorities to implement it)
back: to be someone's responsibility or decision (uma vez que a estratégia estiver definida, CABERÁ as autoridades implementar ela)

front: nod (I see people nodding)
back: acenar com a cabeça [verb] (para cumprimentar ou dizer que 'sim')

front: downplay (Trump downplayed the impact of the U.S. coronavirus outbreak on Twitter this week)
back: minimizar / subestimar (Trump minimizou o impacto do surto de coronavirus no Twitter essa semana)

front: strain (I feel under strain when I speak in public)
back: tensão / pressão (eu sinto sob pressão quando eu falo em publico)

front: at times (at times, I forget to lock the door when I leave)
back: as vezes (as vezes, eu esqueço de trancar a porta quando eu saio)

front: weighted (what is the weighted average of this?)
flat out (they worked flat out on this project / the idea was rejected flat out)
soar (It’s not just Zoom,” he said, referring to the video conferencing company whose shares have soared 130% this year)
hang in there
halfway through (I am halfway through the book 'War and Peace')
back: na metade / no meio (estou na metade do livro War and Peace)

front: steadfast (the president remained steadfast against pressure from the unions)
back: firme (o presidente se manteve firme contra a pressão dos sindicatos)

front: get the hang of something (I’ll teach you how to use the design program, you’ll get the hang of it after a while.)
back: pegar o jeito (vou te ensinar a usar o programa de design, vc vai pegar o jeito depois de um tempo)

front: flea market (there is a flea market every Sunday)
back: a street market selling second–hand goods

front: grim (another grim milestone, more than 2000 people have died of coronavirus)
stem from (his love of the outdoors stems from his father.)
back: vir de algo ou alguem / ser causado por algo ou alguem (seu amor pelo ar livre vem de seu pai)

front: downturn (despite the downturn, the economy will soon recover)
back: declínio, desacelaração (apesar da desaceleração, a economia vai se recuperar em breve) [noun]

front: silver lining (finding a silver lining in quarantine)
back: lado bom de algo (encontrando o lado bom na quarentena)

front: watered–down (USO has become a watered–down version of its former self)
back: diluido, atenuado, enfraquecido (USO se tornou uma versão diluida de sua forma antiga) [adj]

front: to third wheel (he was third wheeling / he was the third wheel)
back: ficar de vela (ele estava ficando de vela), vela (ele foi a vela)

front: upbringing (Paul had a strict upbringing)
back: educação, criação, formação (Paul teve uma educação rígida)

front: peace out
shut off (can you shut off the tv please?)
plunge (the kids immediately plunged into the pool / markets are plunging today)
feel bad for (I feel bad for little mice. I don’t like to kill them)
back: ter dó de algo (eu tenho dó dos ratinhos, eu não gosto de matar eles) (mice = plural de rato)

front: shirt on (I have a blue shirt on / I’m recording this podcast without a shirt on)
back: (eu estou com uma camisa azul / estou gravando esse podcast sem camisa)

front: offhand (I can't think of a better answer offhand)
up against (up against no deal we accept this deal)
back: contra (contra nenhum acordo, nós aceitamos esse acordo)

front: live up (we are just trying to live it up)
back: aproveitar, aproveitar (nós só estamos tentando apreciar)

front: slim down (this a slimmed down version of that other PR)
back: emagrecer, reduzir (esta é uma versão reduzida do outro PR)

front: dodgy (this business seems pretty dodgy)
fishy (how super–rich turn fishy money into empty apartments)
freakout (the next time you find yourself in the middle of a freakout)
close call (my son almost got hit by a bus. It was a close call!)
back: por um triz (meu filho quase foi atropelado por um onibus. Foi por um triz.

front: rosy (the strategy has produced results beyond the most rosy forecasts)
pop out (I have to pop out for a bit to register Sofia at a kindergarden for next year)
back: to leave (some place) for a brief period of time.

front: happen to (do you happen to know my teacher?)
back: por acaso (vc por acaso conhece meu professor?)

front: unruly (the unruly boy refused to obey his parents)
play up (this is just exporter playing up as usual)
to nail down (we finally nail down a routine that we love)
store clerk (I went to a toy store and asked the store clerk where the Arnold Schwarzenegger Action Figurines were. She Replied: 'Aisle B, Back')
to draw (winners will be drawn soon)
back: sortear (vencedores serão sorteados em breve) [esse verbo tbm significa outras coisas, ver outro card]

front: hectic (thanks again for all the hard work yesterday sounds like things are pretty hectic)
back: frenético (parece que as coisas estão bem frenéticas)

front: grow tired (Joe grew tired of his job)
back: se cansar (Joe se cansou do seu emprego)

front: run in (singing runs in our family.)
back: é de família (cantar é de família)

front: how else (how else may i assist you?)
shoehorn (this tiny restaurant is shoehorned between two major banks)
back: to fit something tightly in a particular place, often between two other things

front: henceforth (Tech will fix the mappings but only apply it to incoming submissions henceforth)
how did the rice turn out? / how did the party turn out?
back: como ficou o arroz? / como foi a festa?

front: piggyback (everyone wants to piggyback on the phenomenal success of the TV series)
back: to use something that someone else has made or done in order to get an advantage

front: jinx (I dont wanna jinx things)
make of (well, what did you make of her?)
back: qual a impressão/opinião/entendimento sobre algo (bem, o que você achou dela)

front: sink in (the implications of their defeat were beginning to sink in)
grass on (Dan grassed on them to the local police)
back: dedurar (tell the police or someone in authority about something bad that that person has done)
contar algo a alguem para ouvir a opinião da pessoa (você me falaria sua idea uma vez mais?)
front: run [something] by [someone] (would you run your idea by me one more time?)
cooking on gas (now that we've had this breakthrough with our experiment, we're really cooking on gas)
back: to be making rapid progress or performing efficiently

front: moonlighting (Marcelo and Charles are moonlighting in our tribe for a bit to help out on the user profile work)
back: have a second job, typically secretly and at night, in addition to one's regular employment.

front: in anger (have you used GraphQL in anger? Or just for fun?)
back:
"pra valer", "de verdade" (você já usou GraphQL pra 
valer? Ou apenas por diversão)

front: give or take (8 months give or take)
back: used to indicate that an amount is approximate. If you say that something is fifty years old, give or take a few years, you mean that it is approximately fifty years old
fazer algo dificil/que vc não quer fazer
front: bite the bullet (let's bite the bullet and do it)
out of the woods (we are still not out of the woods)
back: fora de perigo/dificuldades (ainda não estamos sem dificuldades)

front: hinder (price sensitivity may hinder the growth of high-ticket ice cream sales in Brazil)
gutted (we are absolutely gutted with the news)
back: arrasado (nós estamos absolutamente arrasados com essa noticia)

front: jazz up (let's add photos to jazz up the dashboards)
back: to make something more attractive or interesting (vamos adicionar fotos para deixar os dashboards mais atrativos)
rearrajar, organizar diferente (vamos rearranjar os times em breve)
front: rejig (we gonna rejig the teams soon)
how so? (he claimed innocence, but the evidence suggests otherwise. How so?)
have a stab at [something] (let me have a stab at fixing that)
nitty-gritty (we are going to get into some of the nitty-gritty engineering details)
unwind (can’t wait to unwind with you all!)
back roads (we spent a month with the insurgents on back roads and jungle tracks)
back: estradas vicinais / estradas rurais (geralmente de terra)

front: hit on (he was hitting on the girl)
back: dar em cima (ele estava dando em cima da garota)

front: sidetrack (sorry we got sidetracked)
smug (the France team was very smug)

back: a partir de (desenvolvemos o plano a partir das diretrizes fornecidas)
front: off the (we developed the plan off the provided guidelines)
piecemeal (the project is progressing in a slow, piecemeal manner)
halve (Germany plans to halve military aid for Ukraine)

back: temer / ter medo (eu estava com medo do voo longo de volta pra casa)
front: dread (I was dreading the long flight back home)
day in and day out (he works tirelessly, day in and day out, to support his family)
drip by drip, drip feeding

back: transmitir (as cores no gráfico deven transmitir alguma lógica)
front: convey (the colors in the chart should convey some logic)
sprinkle (I am going to sprinkle salt over the meat [verb] / a generous sprinkle of pepper [noun])
back: polvilhar / dar uma pitada (de uma pitada de sal na carne)

front: predicament (James, you know my predicament)
back: situação difícil (James, você sabe minha situação difícil)

front: fiddly (exporting reports to pptx might be fiddly)
back: complicado (quando há muitas pequenas partes envolvidas)
encolher [fisicamente] / se sentir constrangido/evergonhado (eu me sinto constrangido toda vez que ouço uma dessas frases ridiculas)
front: to cringe (I cringe every time I hear one of these ridiculous statements)

back: quer (informal) [quer outro pedaço de bolo? / quer um pouco de café?]
front: care for (care for another piece of cake? / care for some coffee)

back: incomodar (trouble or annoy (someone) with frequent or persistent requests or interruptions)
front: pester (if you don’t know I’ll pester Marcelo)

back: esforçar ao máximo (eu decidi me esforçar ao máximo para melhorar minha fluencia em ingles nesse fim de ano)
front: all out (I decided to go all out to improve my English fluency this end of the year)
jumble (the questions are jumbled up) [noun / verb]
back: uma mistura de confusa de coisas [noun] / misturar coisas de maneira bagunçada [verb]

front: ahorrar (ahorre dinero con tales concelos)
fussy (it's ok with the cool & calm clients but with the fussy ones..)

back: chover bastante (está chovendo bastante aqui no momento)
front: piss down (it's really pissing down here at the moment)
nitpick (you're always nitpicking - it's so annoying!) [verb / noun]
back: ser picuinha, encontrar falhas que não são importantes [verb] / picuinha, pequeno detalhe [noun]
se ao menos (se ao menos meu filhos me obedecessem / se ao menos meu marido me amasse mais)
front: if only + verb (if only my children would obey me / if only my husband were more loving)
short handed (sorry asking this, I know you are short handed)
back: com falta de pessoal (desculpa pedir isso, eu sei que voce está com falta de pessoal)
guarda-sol, de praia, de carro etc (o guarda-sol ajuda a reduzir a temperatura interior)
front: sunshade (the sunshade helps reduce the interior temperature)
invaluable (Meric was invaluable to the company)
chase up (I’m just chasing up with the team at The Loop today on the next steps)
